name: contrary
content:
the contrary
Add to word list
Add to word list
the opposite: I was worried that it might be too hard for me but it turned out the contrary was true. His death will be considered accidental unless the contrary is shown by existing evidence. Generally lower unemployment rates can halt inflation, but the contrary seems to be the case today. on the contrary
B2 used to show that you think or feel the opposite of what has just been stated: "I thought you said the film was exciting?" "On the contrary, I nearly fell asleep half way through it!"
See more to the contrary
C1 saying or showing the opposite: proof/evidence to the contrary For a long time it was thought to be a harmless substance, but we now have proof/evidence to the contrary.
